sections.rubric: Seasonal sentence may replace this line.
sections.text: The LORD is in his holy temple; let all the earth keep silence before him.
Let us humbly confess our sins unto Almighty God.
Almighty and most merciful Father, we have erred and strayed from thy ways like lost sheep...

sections.rubric: If a priest is present, Absolution may be pronounced; otherwise, the Declaration of Remission follows.
sections.text: Almighty God, our heavenly Father, who of his great mercy hath promised forgiveness of sins...
Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy Name...

lines: O come, let us sing unto the LORD;
let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

sections.rubric: From the daily lectionary; conclude with Gloria Patri.
sections.text: [Psalms will appear here.]
A reading from the Old Testament.
Te Deum laudamus / Benedicite, omnia opera / or other as appointed.
A reading from the New Testament.
Benedictus Dominus Deus / or other as appointed.
I believe in God the Father Almighty...
Kyrie – Lord’s Prayer – Suffrages – Collect of the Day – additional collects and intercessions.
O God, make speed to save us. O Lord, make haste to help us.

lines: I lift up my eyes to the hills;
from where is my help to come?

sections.text: A short lesson of Scripture.
Lord, have mercy. Christ, have mercy. Lord, have mercy.
Let us bless the Lord. Thanks be to God.

sections.rubric: Seasonal sentence may replace this line.
sections.text: Jesus spoke, saying, “I am the light of the world; whoever follows me will not walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
Almighty and most merciful Father, we have erred and strayed from thy ways like lost sheep...
Grant, we beseech thee, merciful Lord, to thy faithful people pardon and peace...
Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy Name...
[Psalms for the evening Office.]
A reading from Holy Scripture.
Magnificat / Cantate Domino / etc.
A reading from Holy Scripture.
Nunc dimittis / Deus Misereatur / etc.
I believe in God the Father Almighty...
Suffrages – Collect of the Day – evening collects.
The Lord Almighty grant us a quiet night and a perfect end. Amen.
Most merciful God, we confess to you, before the whole company of heaven and one another, that we have sinned in thought, word, and deed, and in what we have failed to do.

lines: Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness;
you set me at liberty when I was in trouble; have mercy on me and hear my prayer.

sections.text: Be sober, be watchful; for your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion, seeking someone to devour. Resist him, firm in your faith. (1 Peter 5:8–9)
Into your hands, O Lord, I commend my spirit... Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace...
Visit this place, O Lord, and drive far from it all snares of the enemy; let your holy angels dwell with us to preserve us in peace...
Let us bless the Lord. Thanks be to God.
Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Almighty God, our heavenly Father, we confess that we have sinned against thee...
Our Father, who art in heaven...
A brief reading or psalm suitable for family devotion.
Intercessions and thanksgivings offered by the family.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Ghost, be with us all evermore. Amen.
O God, make speed to save us. O Lord, make haste to help us.
A brief verse of Scripture.
Keep watch, dear Lord, with those who work, or watch, or weep this night...
May the blessing of God Almighty, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost, be amongst us, and remain with us always. Amen.
